content.transcript:
The main defence under food legislation is known as the due-diligence defence.

It enables a defendant to be acquitted of an offence if they prove they 'took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to avoid committing the offence'.

To support a due diligence defence, accurate, written records are recommended.

Compliance with industry guides to good hygiene practice will also assist a due-diligence defence.
